title: is my probation permanent?
body:
my account got suspended like 7 month ago (2 week suspension)  because i was toxic, since then i follow the advice you (riot) gave me, to not play if i have a bad day, or just play with my friend and to not do what i did previously. but even though it been seven month later im still under probation without ever being toxic in any game that i play during my probation time. granted i didnt play a lot, because overwatch came out around the time my suspension got lifted. but i still enjoy league, but not getting any crate for this long is becoming annoying. im just wondering do people need to honor me to help me lift the probation because ive show improvement but im still in probation.

P.S sorry for the  bad grammar

replies.body: No, you can get your account back in good standing. Just avoid being reported for valid reasons.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Tantram,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=EhE5pxie,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2016-12-12T23:41:18.167+0000)
>
> No, you can get your account back in good standing. Just avoid being reported for valid reasons.

Also avoid Riot tantram he bans peopel that file complaints against him. Doesn't contact them about the issue of the witch hunts he leads and uses templar to ban people. I'll link a reddit post soon to show what he did. He is on the player behavior team after all so he actually places higher prefs on people that they dislike or people that might file complaints about their actions.

Wut? I don't even ban people. That's player support:-). 

I'm not a hunter. I love animals too much. Witches? I think they're pretty cool.

I'm a tech lead for the Player Behavior team. I draw diagrams:-).

> [{quoted}](name=OMG halp meh plz,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=EhE5pxie,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2016-12-13T00:19:05.098+0000)

you can't

> [{quoted}](name=scazzman,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=EhE5pxie,comment-id=000200000000,timestamp=2016-12-13T00:27:43.602+0000)
>
> you can't

You actually can by requesting privacy information through Riot's Privacy site. You can see your chat logs and reports made against you, from which you can infer whether your account is in good standing.
unless you're bad and don't get chests.

> [{quoted}](name=OMG halp meh plz,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=EhE5pxie,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2016-12-13T00:19:05.098+0000)
>
> How can you tell if your account is in good standing or not?

https://privacy.riotgames.com/en_US/stage2
You can see the reports made against you, from which you can probably deduce if you're in poor standing or not. If the reports seem valid, then you might be on the edge of a chat restriction. If you're getting few reports or invalid ones, then you're in good standing.
Also, you get to look at your chat logs, another tool to see whether you're in good standing.

So, I got a 75 game chat restrict a long time ago, but if I would start being toxic again, would I immediatly get a 2 week ban or chat restrictions again?
Right now I am not toxic (as far as I know), but I have started playing ranked and that can be frustrating.

Scazzman is correct.  You can begin to earn hextech loot rewards within a few weeks for the char restrictions, maybe 1-2 months for the longer ones, but you will be able to do it soon.  However, that does not mean that you have dropped down to the tier one for punishment again.  That takes much longer.  I've seen people take as long as 6-7 months after a temp ban end up with a permaban.  They had begun to receive rewards again and thought they were safe.  They were not.

hextech rewards eligibility isn't based on time but on games played.

it'll take around 120-150 games.

keep in mind that when you've receive your rewards back doesn't mean that you are free to be toxic again.

> [{quoted}](name=Kei143,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=EhE5pxie,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2016-12-12T23:22:01.024+0000)

> it'll take around 120-150 games.
> 
> keep in mind that when you've receive your rewards back doesn't mean that you are free to be toxic again.

thx for the insight, also i know that even if my probation is lifted that didnt mean i can be toxic lol

Nope, honour has nothing to do with the loot restriction.  If you keep playing without getting punished, eventually it will lift.  It's not a certain # of games or time either, but if you almost never play then it'll take a lot of time irl for it to lift probably (if you don't play it can never tell if you're usually sportsmanlike or not).
